pullRequest.body:
---

The zulip workflow is entirely cargo-culted from #16296; please review carefully.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f18acca564](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16303/commits/f18acca5644bf0efdfc8931640a13b9a7a3ee58e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ checkTitleLabels`
`+ checkTitleLabelsCLI`
`+ hasContradictoryLabels`
`+ main`
`+ splitAtPos`
`+ validateTitle`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Thanks again!
CI looks green now: I don't mind if this is reviewed together with #17649 or separately.
I don't feel qualified to review the Lean code - @joneugster does everything look good to you now?

Thanks for writing this!

I had a quick read through and I wonder whether some of the checks are a little too restrictive (e.g., the one about lower-casing the title).

Could you run the `#check_title` script on a sample of actual PR titles to verify that it only flags titles that do indeed look malformed in some way?

Moreover, is this check triggered only by push?  Does this mean that the only way to get CI to pass is to change the title and then push a change to the PR?

Maybe this check should take place in a separate CI workflow and be triggered by modification of the title (assuming that this is possible, I'm not sure).

Finally, it may be easier to start with a single check and extend the scope of the validation of the title step by step.
Thanks for your careful review! I just revamped the logic, which should be much more robust now.
Left a few comments. I think overall it looks great, but a way to suppress it in case of false positives would be nice to have

Thanks for writing this!

I had a quick read through and I wonder whether some of the checks are a little too restrictive (e.g., the one about lower-casing the title).

Could you run the `#check_title` script on a sample of actual PR titles to verify that it only flags titles that do indeed look malformed in some way?

Moreover, is this check triggered only by push?  Does this mean that the only way to get CI to pass is to change the title and then push a change to the PR?

Maybe this check should take place in a separate CI workflow and be triggered by modification of the title (assuming that this is possible, I'm not sure).

Finally, it may be easier to start with a single check and extend the scope of the validation of the title step by step.

This needs to be quoted otherwise `*` etc in the title might be interpreted as a glob
```suggestion
          echo "$title"
```

Same as above
```suggestion
          echo "$label_names"
```

* If "main" is not allowed to contain any furture `:`, the `if ... < 2` should probably be adjusted to `if ... != 2`
* otherwise if a title like ``feat: adding a `:` to the docstring of my tactic`` is allowed, then `main := parts[1]!` is not doing the right thing.

I think Actionlint suggests using `env` in the workflow step, cf. [the example here](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/security-for-github-actions/security-guides/security-hardening-for-github-actions#using-an-intermediate-environment-variable)).
Do you want to check for `feat:     adding bad whitespaces`, too?
Good point, added!
`feat(Mathlib)(Test)` is valid under your test.

Optional thoughts:

* Ideally one would add another test that the "scope" is of the form `Algebra/Basic` without a starting `Mathlib/` and without `.lean` at the end.
* other idea: testing that `Algebra/Basic` or `Algebra/Basic.lean` actually exists on disk is probably out of scope or not possible, is it?

- I added checks for scope being well-formed
- checking the directory exists on disk is not ideal. I *could* read in `Mathlib.lean` (this is what `lint-style.lean` does) --- do you mind if I do so in a follow-up?

Ah, now that I actually try to parse the position indicators in the error messages, it looks like there are still quoting issues in this line:
```suggestion
          lake exe check-title-labels "$TITLE" "$label_names"
```
Aren't these already covered above?
update
Indeed; done

```suggestion
    ...labels : String; "Label name(s) of this PR"
```
I think this should give you an `Array String` of labels which you can access with

```lean
let labels : Array String := args.variableArgsAs! String
```

so you don't need to split manually.

See `outputs` in [import-graph](https://github.com/leanprover-community/import-graph/blob/0a756018b736ef4f4bc3c9a45fc03cf97a0b1a0c/Main.lean#L28-L33) for an example.
Ah, that's the syntax for passing an array of arguments. Much nicer indeed, thank you!

```suggestion
        if: github.event.pull_request.draft == false
```
should do this

```suggestion
/-- Split a string at a given position. Assumes `pos` is valid. -/
```

```suggestion
        if: github.event.pull_request.draft == false and github.event.pull_request.base == 'master'
```
It might be good to add a check that the PR is into `master` since sometimes people open PRs into other PR branches and presumably we don't care about the title or labels for those.
Good point, added!
This could give false positives on acronyms
Perhaps also check whether scope is `/` separated or `.` separated?
The check for "awaiting-zulip" is duplicated here
This should be covered by checking that the type ends with a `)`

```suggestion
```
This test seems to be a duplicate of a previous one.

pullRequest.title: feat(CI): check for badly formatted titles or missing/contradictory labels

source.title: feat: add a script to check for PR title and labelling
